priorVersion.title: CDISC SDTM Ophthalmic Exam Test Code Terminology

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C117743

self.title: CDISC SDTM Ophthalmic Exam Test Code Terminology

definition: Terminology relevant to the test codes that describe findings from ophthalmic examinations.
name: Ophthalmic Exam Test Code
preferredTerm: CDISC SDTM Ophthalmic Exam Test Code Terminology

terms.definition: A measurement of the location, in degrees, of the flatter principal meridian on a 180-degree scale, where 90 degrees designates the vertical meridian and 180 degrees designates the horizontal meridian.
A measurement of the number of cells contained in a unit of volume or area.
The maximum number in a group of values that represent the cell density.
The minimum number in a group of values that represent the cell density.
The mean number in a group of values that represent the cell density.
The standard deviation in a group of values that represent the cell density.
An indication as to whether an eye lens(es) is worn by the subject to correct for distance.
A description of the type of eye lens(es) worn by the subject to correct for distance.
The appearance of objects (or light sources) described in terms of a person's perception of their hue and lightness (or brightness) and saturation. (NCI)
The ratio of the diameter of the optic cup compared to the diameter of the optic disc. (NCI)
The position on a scale to assess diabetic macular edema.
The position on a scale to assess diabetic retinopathy.
The length of a straight line passing through the center of a circle or sphere and connecting two points on the circumference. (NCI)
The minimum number in a group of values that represent the diameter of an object.
The mean number in a group of values that represent the diameter of an object.
The standard deviation in a group of values that represent the diameter of an object.
An evaluation of edema (an excessive amount of watery fluid) in a biological specimen or location.
The position on a scale to assess the degree of comfort associated with the administration of an eye drop.
The position on a scale to assess hyperemia.
An evaluation of hyperemia (an increased amount of blood) in a biological specimen or location.

An act or process of elucidation; explication, or explanation of the meaning of the event or thing via the assignment of objects from the domain to the constants of a formal language, truth-values to the proposition symbols, truth-functions to the connectives, other functions to the function symbols, and extensions to the predicates, if any. The assignments are result of human logic application and are not native to the symbols of the formal language.
The fluid pressure within the eye.
The longest possible length of a straight line passing through the center of a circular or spheroid object that connects two points on the circumference.
The condition or state of the lens of the eye. (NCI)
A number or range of numeric values on the log scale that measures performance, function, quality, or ability.
A measurement of the distance from the inferior limbus to the central upper-eyelid margin, with the patient's gaze pointed upward.
The smallest angle of separation that allows an image-forming device, including the retina, to distinguish two objects as distinct entities.
The base-10 logarithm of the minimum angle of resolution achieved by an individual during testing.
A measurement of the distance between the corneal light reflex to the central upper-eyelid margin, with the patient's gaze in the primary position (i.e., straight ahead).
A measurement of the distance between the corneal light reflex to central lower-eyelid margin, with the patient's gaze in the primary position (i.e., straight ahead).
The minimum distance from the retina that an object remains in clear focus.
The integer that describes the number of characters read by the subject during an eye chart assessment.
The integer that describes the number of characters not able to be read by the subject during an eye chart assessment.
The integer that describes the number of letters correctly identified by the subject during an eye chart assessment.
terms.preferredTerm: Number of Correct Eye Chart Letters

terms.definition: The integer that describes the number of lines read by the subject during an eye chart assessment.
terms.preferredTerm: Number of Eye Chart Lines Read

terms.definition: The integer that describes the number of lines not able to be read by the subject during an eye chart assessment.
An observation, assessment or examination of the eye.
An assessment of the degree of opaqueness or the lack of transparency.
A description of the action in response to some kind of stimulus.

A measurement of the extent of defect in vision caused by a mismatch of optical power between the cylindrical and horizontal meridians, resulting in sub-optimal reflection of light onto the retina. (NCI)

A measurement of the extent of defect in vision caused by a mismatch of optimal power between the cornea and/or lens and the length of the eyeball, resulting in sub-optimal reflection of light onto the retina. (NCI)
The spatial arrangement of something as distinct from its substance. (NCI)
The actual distance between the subject and the eye chart during an eye assessment.
terms.preferredTerm: Actual Subject to Eye Chart Distance
synonyms: Subject to Eye Chart Actual Distance

terms.definition: The planned distance between the subject and the eye chart during an eye assessment.
terms.preferredTerm: Planned Subject to Eye Chart Distance
synonyms: Subject to Eye Chart Planned Distance

terms.definition: A measurement of the amount of tear production in a subject.
A measurement of the amount of tears being secreted over a defined amount of time (e.g. 5 minutes).
The dimension between two surfaces of an object, usually the smallest dimension as opposed to the width or the length.
The maximum number in a group of values that represent the thickness of an object.
The minimum number in a group of values that represent the thickness of an object.
The mean number in a group of values that represent the thickness of an object.
The standard deviation in a group of values that represent the thickness of an object.
A measurement of the number of horizontal or vertical lines within a pre-determined unit of length on a visual acuity card.
